qas.question: Which city is considered one of the oldest settlements in North America?
Around what year did settlement begin to occur in St. John's?
When was Cuper's Cove colony founded?
What year was Bristol's Hope colony founded?
Who forbade the  english fisherman to setup seasonal camps in Newfoundland?
What is the oldest settlement in The America's?
What type of settlement began in the 16th century?
What is one of the colonies Besides St John's established in the 16th century?
Where were fishermen encouraged to set up permanet settlements?

context: <a0_0>St. John's<a0_0/> is one of the oldest settlements in North America, with <b6_0>year-round<b6_0/> settlement beginning sometime after <a1_0>1630<a1_0/> and seasonal habitation long before that. It is not, however, the oldest surviving English settlement in North America or Canada, having been preceded by the Cuper's Cove colony at Cupids, founded in <a2_0>1610<a2_0/>, and the <b7_0>Bristol's Hope colony<b7_0/> at Harbour Grace, founded in <a3_0>1618<a3_0/>. In fact, although English fishermen had begun setting up seasonal camps in Newfoundland in the 16th Century, they were expressly forbidden by the <a4_0>British government<a4_0/>, at the urging of the West Country fishing industry, from establishing permanent settlements <b8_0>along the English controlled coast<b8_0/>, hence the town of St. John's was not established as a permanent community until after the 1630s at the earliest. Other permanent English settlements in the Americas that predate St. John's include: St. George's, Bermuda (1612) and <b5_0>Jamestown, Virginia<b5_0/> (1607).
